content:
I woke up with a heavy heart when I heard last night about the passing of  FDNY firefighter Bill Tolley. As many of you know, I am married to Fireman who ironically started his career with the FDNY at Ladder 135, Engine 286 in Glendale where Bill worked tirelessly for 17 years.  

My husband called me yesterday with the sad news as he rushed to Wyckoff Hospital to see if there was anything he could do.  His voice on the phone was somber and I knew immediately it was bad news.  

I had met Bill and his wife Marie at several FDNY family function for the firehouse over the years. He was kind, gracious and a gentleman. He always had a smile on his face and I just remember a couple who loved each other tremendously.  My heart is broken for Marie and their beautiful daughter. There are no words. No words!

 As many of you know being a Firefighter and part of the FDNY is a brotherhood.  We hear that all the time. But I can tell you first hand the love, support and respect firefighters have for each other  is something I have never experienced ever.   And I know during this incredibly difficult time, the brotherhood will not let his family down.  

So this morning as you wake up, keep Bill  and his family in your prayers.  God bless him and his family. üíî
New York City Fire Department (FDNY)
name: Sukanya Krishnan

content: Thank you everyone for your kind  words. Its been my honor to be apart of your family for the past 17 years. I will be leaving PIX at the end of the month.  My time here has been filled with nothing but love. Be FEARLESS and complete the journey!
name: Sukanya Krishnan

content:
I would just like to thank all of you for your kind words.  I am speechless by the so many beautiful comments you have written.  I have read all of them and I have cried.  They have all touched my heart.   
We have shared so much together and tonight I will share this with you Emmy Night 2017.  I am up for best news anchor and best morning show with my friend Scott Stanford.  I wasn't going to go but I decided that life is too short and every moment and accomplishment must be celebrated, espically now.  ‚ù§.Wish me luck.
name: Sukanya Krishnan

content: Missing my family already.  It's been an amazing ride and now the countdown begins.  8 working days left and saying goodbye to all of you will be one of the hardest things I will do.   Thanking all of you.  üôèüèΩ. Your words have comforted me!!

title: Photos from Sukanya Krishnan's post

content:
Suki: You know what they say about music?
Scott: No Suki what do they say?
Suki: When you're happy you enjoy the music When you're sad you understand the lyrics. 
üíî
name: Sukanya Krishnan

content:
6 more days left on air and there are many things on my mind.  We have all been friends for a long time but the next few days will take an enormous amount of courage to leave something I have loved doing.   Have you ever loved something so much it hurts to say goodbye?

I keep telling myself  this...keep me focused at a time when it feels like things are unraveling. Let's all become bigger than our situation and dig deep.  It will take courage and a great spirit to have a new larger outlook on life.  

Life is never perfect.  We all know there are twists and turns. But what I have learned is that you have to be brave, be courageous and be determined. 
 It's not where you are that matter, it's where you are going.  üíï
name: Sukanya Krishnan
